reviews.text: The Mirarmar was a great hotel for our trip in May. It's not a five-star hotel at all, but the location is perfect and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. I traveled with my mom and she is a smoker and the Miramar is one of the only hotels that offer smoking floors. The room was very clean and kept clean throughout our stay. The beds are very comfortable and having a fairly spacious balcony was great. We even had a small view of the ocean which was beautiful.
reviews.title: Why spend all your time in the hotel room while in Hawaii?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other reviews have said, this isn't The Ritz, but why would you go to Hawaii to spend your entire vacation in your hotel room? There is so much to see and do in Oahu! We rented a car for a day and drove to the Northshore which was beautiful. We took the bus to Diamond Head and to Hanauma Bay. Both easy to get to and cheaper than a cab! We did a lot in the view days were were there so if you have any questions, message me. We had a great time and would stay there again because you won't spend a lot there so you can use your money elsewhere!
reviews.title: Stay Away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked what I thought would be a holiday of a lifetime and was assured by the travel agent we booked through that this was a great hotel for the money in a perfect location. My husband and I were so excited when we set off on our trip, however on walking into our room, I cried. It was not particularly clean, it smelt (as did the corridor) and was far from being even classed as outdated. The view was onto a parking lot and the noise from the busy road was intolerable. Lucky enough we were upgraded to a better room at no charge, but I would never go back. We queued for the complimentary breakfast which was below standard. The juice was served in paper cups and the eating area was not appealing with many dirty dishes left on tables. The location was okay but for a dream holiday or otherwise it is substandard.
reviews.title: Great location and great service and a good value

reviews.text: We stayed at the Miramar as part of a pre-cruise package through our travel agent and thought the price and the location were excellent. The hotel itself is about a 3 star but being next to the International Market Place and 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach was perfect. We originally had a partial ocean view room on the 15th floor with an ok view, but after we had a peeping-tom neighbor stick his head around our balcony divider and look into our room at 6: AM while we were laying in bed drinking our coffee the management moved us to the 21st floor with an amazing view of Waikiki Beach and a much nicer room. Couldn't believe someone could be that stupid to lean over the railing around the privacy divider and look into someone else's room! The rooms are a little small and not real plush, but comfortable and clean enough. The breakfast that was included in the rate was very good and we liked the pool area with lots of loungers and sun. We were so busy seeing and doing all of the Honolulu and Waikiki stuff that we weren't in our room that much anyway. I would definately recommend this hotel to people who would like to save a little money on their room and use it other places.
reviews.title: Moldy, dirty and unkept hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed from March 21st to the 28th 2009. The hotel room on arrival smelled moldy. We kept the air conditioner running full time to try and keep the moldy smell down. There were water stains on the wall, as well as above the patio door where there was a crack in the cieling tile whrere rusty water had come thru.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, nice staff - can't wait to go back!
Our next stay would not be Miramar,Ohau
reviews.text: We stafed Dec 6-13,2009. My husband and I are 60 yrs old and retired. We stayed 7 days and although we were not in the room that much, for maybe the same or a few dollars more we could have stayed in a nicer hotel. We had the best room there was according to the front desk, which meant we saw the ocean from our balcony alright, but there were mutiple hotels in the view between our hotel and the ocean. Never saw the sunset from our balcony. That view was blocked by buildings. The rooms are clean, staff are friendly and helpful but everything is tired and worn including the rug. Bed was comfortable. Frig was handy. We had breakfast included in our package from the travel agent and that was nice as it saved some money. If not I am not sure I would not have paid the $19.50US each for breakfast at Sammys. It was good but that is a lot of money for breakfast. The toaster did not work well at all and seemed a simple fix but it was not fixed for the week we were there. We did not travel to Hawii to stay in the motel, so overall is was alright, but my next visit will not be there. Good location??? There are lots of them in good locations and you can get to the International market from almost anywhere, besides the Beach is what we wanted. We ate at Chilis across the street, barbequed our own meat at the ShoreBird? at Waikiki Shore Hotel on the beach,met new friends Jerri and Dave for dinner at Cheesecake Cafe. Hiked Diamond Head, snorkled Hanauma Bay twiced, bussed the North Shore for surfing competitions, swam Waikiki Beach where I even managed to see a turtle. Bus system worked well ( $2.25 correct change needed). Also used the taxis who stop at bus stops and yell at you $5.00 Hanama Bay because they get you there direct once the van is full that is. I now understand that there is a van that stops at Duke's statue on Waikiki Beach and for $5.00 each way you can go to the discount mall. Lots of shopping if that is your thing. Loved Hawaii and felt very safe there, no beggers, friendly locals, street entertainment at night,whatever you heart desires is avaiable. The 20% tipping gets a little expensive for us, but when the service is great we did not mind as much. We do not like to insult Hawaiians by not tipping the 20%, but they have to remember that the holiday was already more expensive that may other beach all inclusive resorts. We will be back to Hawaii, just not this hotel. 2nd week we flew to Maui and loved that as well. Stayed at the Royal Lahanie which was way better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Miramar Dec 4, 2009. There are tons of hotels to choose from in this location. My question is would you fly all this way, pay three times the Miramar rates to stay in a fancier hotel with more facilities and not step outside the building? If so, go ahead. For me, I was happy with a basic, decent hotel with good approachable staff and a safe clean place to sleep. I spent each day and a good part of the night enjoying the great weather, beaches, restaurants and crowds just outside the door. My wife and I had a room issue that was corrected quickly. If you expect courteous, polite service, why not present yourself in the same manner? It works wonders.
reviews.title: Good value, now go out and enjoy the sun!

reviews.text: Stayed 7 days with family and have some very mixed reviews.
reviews.title: Hard to say....
Horrible Hotel
reviews.text: Pros: The location is fantastic! So close to the shopping (International Market place is literary downstairs), beach and an overpriced Food Pantry across the street. Fatty's Chinese kitchen is a must if you like Chinese food. Portions were huge and well worth the money. No issues with staff and extra towels were delivered right away. Free access to the fridge and safe in the room were also a bonus.

reviews.title: Genuinely Not Good for what you are paying!!!!!
reviews.text: Cons: We stayed on the 20th floor and the ventilation was horrible. You would always get the greasy restaurant smell once you get off the elevators which sometimes creep into the room. Unfortunately we had a room right beside a party crowd so the thin walls and even thinner windows on the balcony made it seem like we were IN the party. Since the hotel is right beside the International Marketplace I saw plenty of cockroaches on the main floor. HUGE ones! Never saw any in the hotel room, just on the main floor. Parking garage was also a bit gross. Small stalls and you had to walk by all the garbage piled up from all restaurants - so hold your breath.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is way overdue for a major rework.
reviews.title: Needs Major Work

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem is with a broken down plumbing system. Probably broken sewer pipes.
reviews.title: Miramar Hotel, good location, average quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The problem stemming from this is bugs, lots of bugs crawling there way up through the pipes and into the rooms.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs

reviews.text: The little refridge in the room was vintage 1960 and didnt keep anything cold.
reviews.title: Decent but not top notch

reviews.text: Old patch work repairs in the rooms.
reviews.title: Decent value, but there are nicer options
4 nights
reviews.text: Really enjoyed this motel... was in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Miramar Hotel pre-cruise. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view and it was wonderful. From one side of the lanai we had views of the ocean and from the other side, we were looking directly at Diamondhead. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but went two doors down to the Galaxy Restaurant. The breakfasts were only around $4 there and they were very good. The Miramar is located right next to the International Marketplace, so shopping and food are right at your side. It's probably the best location in Waikiki. We would stay here again in a heartbeat! The only negative is the "street walkers" that are all over Waikiki in the evening. Nothing the Miramar can really do about this.
reviews.title: Miramar was GREAT!

reviews.text: We enjoyed everything about this hotel. The pool wasn't busy at all. The location is great, close to everything. All the employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, plenty of clean towels, soap and shampoo.Room was a good size, had a double and two twins, a balcony, a fridge,a safe and a coffee maker. Located across the street from the food pantry(grocery store). There is an ABC store on every block. A block from the beach.The only flaw was the ladies of the night walking up and down the street in front of the hotel asking every man if he was alone. But that is not the hotels problem. Seen alot of police presence, felt safe. If you are looking for a resort, this is just a hotel. It worked for us. Parking was $14 for 24 hours if you rent a car. If you rent a car, bring GPS with you, very helpful. Alot of restaurants nearby have happy hours with great special on food and drinks, all have slightly different times.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we went here on our honeymoon, which probably wasn't the best idea since its not very romantic, but we wanted something cheap. the location was really good, we were able to walk everywhere without any problems. the room had a balcony, which was nice, and since we were on our honeymoon, they gave us a free bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: ok hotel, you get what you pay for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: breakfast was decent. they had scrambled eggs, french toast, pancakes, sausages, bacon, hashbrowns, cereal, toast, and pastries. we always went for breakfast as soon as they opened, and we didn't have any problems with a line up.
reviews.title: cleanliness a big problem at this hotel
